definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: Strictly adheres to food apportionment policy to effectively control costs.
sentences.chinese: 嚴格執行食品分攤政策以控制成本。

sentences.english: It penalises lower-rated assets and rewards the spreading of risk.
sentences.chinese: 這使得低等級資產陷於不利處境但有利於分攤風險。

sentences.english: Each member of the club will be assessed 50 dollars to pay for the trip.
sentences.chinese: 俱樂部會員每人將分攤50元以便支付旅行費用。

sentences.english: Forecast and share of freight volume is the main content of Logistics Park's planning.
sentences.chinese: 物流量的預測及其分攤是物流園區規劃的重要內容。

sentences.english: He wanted to amortize his fixed rental cost by stretching the operating hours.
sentences.chinese: 他想用延長營業時間來分攤固定的租金。

sentences.english: Expenses are to be divided between those who are living in the residential hotel.
sentences.chinese: 這些費用應由住在家用旅店的那些人分攤。

sentences.english: The aggregate carrying value of the business reputation apportioned to the above-mentioned asset groups;
sentences.chinese: 分攤到上述資產組的商譽的賬面價值合計。

sentences.english: Prorate the height of the tidal waves.
sentences.chinese: 按比例分攤海嘯的高度。

sentences.english: Or someone who can split with you the cost of a car or a guide.
sentences.chinese: 或者找個能和你分攤車費或導遊費的人。

sentences.english: We stood in with him who bought us the meals.
sentences.chinese: 他爲我們買回了喫的，大家分攤了那筆錢。

sentences.english: The fixed-dollar amount of percentage rate used to allocate overhead costs to a specific product.
sentences.chinese: 固定百分比的金額，用於將經常費用分攤至具體產品。

sentences.english: This Act may be cited as the Uniform Contribution Among Tortfeasors Act.
sentences.chinese: 本法被引用時應被稱爲《統一侵權責任分攤法案》。

sentences.english: Deciding on how to divvy up the output cuts is a pivotal detail.
sentences.chinese: 如何分攤所削減的產量將是決定的關鍵細節所在。

sentences.english: Carpooling is a smart way to share your ride and your expenses.
sentences.chinese: 拼車是一種你們合夥乘車和分攤費用的精明方法。

sentences.english: Strictly adheres to the food apportionment policy to control costs.
sentences.chinese: 嚴格執行食品分攤政策以控制成本。

sentences.english: There's also a problem with risk-sharing at that level.
sentences.chinese: 還有另一個風險分攤程度的問題。

definition: to share (a burden, a cost, a responsibility)
to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
saving/to save/to use sparingly/to cut down on
